body: @sokra - did what you recommended, still, the issue remains. If I understand correctly, the guide (https://github.com/webpack/changelog-v5/blob/master/guides/persistent-caching.md) tells that it should compare the snapshots, and other fancy stuff to find the changed tree.
You have to put **all** build files to `buildDependencies` - and `webpack.config.js` and `app/config/webpack.config.js` in your case, because both can change your output
Try to set `cache: false` and you will have the same problem
Also you need to put `.babelrc` also

The problem is here:
```js
// app/config/webpack.config.js

filename: BUILD ? '[name].js?[contenthash]' : '[name].bundle.js',`
```

with `[name].js?[contenthash]` it does not work, but with `[name].bundle.js` - everything is fine.

Yes, it is interesting case/bug, we do not look at source code if it is `immutable` file (i.e filename contains `contenthash`), but you have  `contenthash` in query and no query on filesystem, so webpack only checks if the file exists, because `[contenthash]` always generate unique hash
Having `?[contenthash]` helps us to temporary keep the old files between releases for users, who have not refreshed the page yet.
Honestly, using `[contenthash]` for query is real not good idea, but anyway we should fix it
ah I see... that's a problem

issue.title: re-check immutable state when removing a query string

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.
